about_the_game:
"

Devin Night Pack 171: Desert Sands

This pack contains nomadic tribesmen and women from remote desert  locations. This pack contains headless images and separate head images that can be used to create your own tokens. 1. Find the module within the Assets window.
2. Create a new campaign image record
3. Set the grid size to the size you want the token to be (100 pixels, 256 pixels, etc.)
4. Drag the body image asset from the Assets window into the new image record.
5. Do the same for the head image and position it by using the Tiles mode within the Image Control
   (tip: use CTRL+mouse drag to ignore any snapping to the grid)
6. Click on the Export image button at the bottom of the Image Control
   (tip: we recommend saving it as a webp image into the tokens folder for the campaign or for FGU). This product includes:
  • DS_Archer
  • DS_Archer2
  • DS_Archer3
  • DS_Assassin
  • DS_Assassin2
  • DS_Assassin2a
  • DS_Champion
  • DS_Commoner
  • DS_Commoner2
  • DS_Commoner2A
  • DS_Commoner3
  • DS_CommonerA
  • DS_Djinn
  • DS_Djinn_Smoke
  • DS_Djinn_SmokeA
  • DS_F_Archer2
  • DS_F_Archer2a
  • DS_F_AssassinA
  • DS_F_AssassinB
  • DS_F_Commoner
  • DS_F_Commoner2
  • DS_F_Dancer
  • DS_F_Soldier
  • DS_F_Soldier2
  • DS_Heavy_Armor
  • DS_Heavy_Armor2
  • DS_Heavy_Armor2a
  • DS_Light_Armor
  • DS_Light_Armor2
  • DS_Mage1
  • DS_Undead
  • DS_Undead2
"
detailed_description:
"

Devin Night Pack 171: Desert Sands

This pack contains nomadic tribesmen and women from remote desert  locations. This pack contains headless images and separate head images that can be used to create your own tokens. 1. Find the module within the Assets window.
2. Create a new campaign image record
3. Set the grid size to the size you want the token to be (100 pixels, 256 pixels, etc.)
4. Drag the body image asset from the Assets window into the new image record.
5. Do the same for the head image and position it by using the Tiles mode within the Image Control
   (tip: use CTRL+mouse drag to ignore any snapping to the grid)
6. Click on the Export image button at the bottom of the Image Control
   (tip: we recommend saving it as a webp image into the tokens folder for the campaign or for FGU). This product includes:
